The ENRON Ride Start Instructions Please Readare now the ENRON and have been officially notified that we have earned first position in the Super Team Start That means we are the very first out the gate again this year AWESOME Thanks to all of you for your recruiting efforts Weve gained riders from last year MEET YOUR TEAM IN THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF TULLY STADIUM To start this adventure just show up with your bike and all your gear at Tully Stadium I Dairy Ashford no later than AM on Saturday the th The feeder road going east on I from Dairy Ashford leads you to Tully Toad dedicated as a oneway street that morning Turn right onto Tully and enter Tully Stadium grounds in the first gates No vehicles of any kind will be allowed into the parking lot from Dairy Ashford so save yourself some time and just follow the crowd in from the feeder road Please park your vehicle and then go ask questions if needed so that you dont jam up the entrance There are dropoff points for your luggage Each rider should have luggage tags which are the same numbers as your helmet and bike numbers AM Team Picture Southeast Corner of Parking Lot in the Stadium AM Stage for Exit Northwest Corner of Parking Lot AM The Enron out the gate You have a Tully Stadium map in your rider manual The Top Team Start will be at AM staging at AM and its very important to be there on time If youre not in the staging area in time for our start youll be stuck back with the crowd and it could take you as long as two hours to get out the gate Allow enough time to park unload luggage and get geared up remembering that the freeway will be jammed up even that early We want you there for the team picture and we dont want to leave without you so please be there plenty early I recommend arriving at AM Please wear your Enron jersey the first day This helps us to quickly identify who should be starting with us I did consent to let five IZUZU riders start with us Since theyre sponsoring the whole event I figured you guys wouldnt mind So just be nice If you have any questions about any of this please email me or call me at Ill be out of the office the rest of this week in attending a conference but will be checking messages and email when possible My home number is and cell phone is On Friday Im picking up my kids who are flying in and getting their bikes ready etc but call if you need anything

HIT IT HARD THIS WEEKENDteam This is your last chance to train and what an opportunity to train with Dan Lyons who knows the ropes and wants to help you train Not only thathes good for a laugh The guy who loves Hawaiin shirts and loves to cycle interesting combination Hes also a bigleague fundraiser and has now just crossed the mark My wish for you is that you get to so that you can can enjoy the Tour of Champions in Sedona with Dan and the gang Itll be a trip youll never forget the mountain biking maybe but the Hawaiin shirts never miles or miles your choice for this weekend Saturday April The mile ride will start at AM sharp from Tomball Middle SchoolJr High on FMwhich is the main street of Tomball about a mile east of TX To get there either take TX north to FM and turn right and go about a mile east or take I North to FM and go west until you hit Tomball and go through town to the start point It will go north through Egypt and Honea up to Montgomery and then north and west to Richards in Grimes County via the Sam Houston National Forest It will then loop west and south coming back via Dacus and Dobbin This century will get you ready for the big ride The main ride will be a fairly hilly century designed to get you ready for the the following weekend but the map provided at the start will also show a mile route that is only lightly hilled PS Dan wont be in the office this week so if you have any questions too bad Just kidding call me and Ill see if I can help Saturday April Official MS Training Ride Bike Barn Clear Lake AM miles Bike Barn Bike Barn AND AS A GRAND FINALE TO THE WEEKEND WHY NOT DO RIDE FOR THE ROSES IN AUSTIN ON SUNDAY APRIL Ride for the Roses was started years ago to honor Lance Armstrongs return from cancer and benefits the Lance Armstrong Foundation It starts at AM at the Travis County Expo Center at Decker Lane in Austin and you can get more information on their websitewwwlaforg It is to miles Attached is the registration form

Pedal Partnersback to browse through our notes on why we do this crazy thing called the MS we find that the primary inspiration is to assist the MS Society in its mission to encourage and provide for the needs of MS patients and give them the hope of endless possibilities PEDAL FOR PARTNERS is a new program this year designed to help MS patients feel part of the trek It creates a bond with them that is much appreciate and it gives them hope to know that were out there Those who could ride would ride and some of those who cant are waiting at the finish line in Austin to tell you how much it meant to them to see you come in on your bike IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO WEAR A RIBBON ON YOUR RIDE WHICH HAS BEEN SIGNED BY AN MS PATIENT IT WOULD BE GREATLY APPRECIATED THAT PERSONS ADDRESS IS PROVIDED ALONG WITH THE RIBBON SO THAT WHEN YOU GET BACK YOU CAN MAIL IT TO THE INDIVIDUAL FOR WHOM YOU RODE You can pick one up at the meeting tomorrow get one from me in AC Stephanie Strong at EB or Becky Pham at EBA For you nonEnron riders if youll let us know this week we can mail it to you

TRY THISnot too late to train for the MS regardless of what some people have told you and if youre struggling with the whole reality of actually getting all the way to Austin just think of it as miles at a time That will get you there Another tool is visualizing every night before you go to sleep shut your eyes and visualize yourself on your little bike going across the map from Houston to Austin over and over and over It works Ive done it If virtual training wont be enough get out this weekend on your bike and heres some great ideas for you Of course we have the Tour deCypress but dont try to keep up with CHARLA REESE she got a brand new bike and she is SMOKIN This is a great ride the first miles is wonderfully scenic and that last miles is great resistance training in the wind Sunday April AM or miles Cypress Spring High School FM and Fry Road Sponsor Northwest Cyclery Saturday April AM or miles HBC ride CypressPrairie View Flat roads through ranching and rice farming country around Waller and Hockley Very little traffic Eat after the ride at The Kettle at US FM MEET miles NW on US to CypressRosehill Road north miles to Huffmeister Park in HLPs parking lot on west side farthest from the building Ride Starter David Dick Sunday April AM or miles Chappell Hill One of the prettier rides for wildflowers in the spring The short route heads north on FM for miles to the stop sign at FM then heads east on FM another miles to Washington on the Brazos State Park The long route turns left at the stop sign travels west on FM and takes a winding route through some minor hills before ending up at the Washington on the Brazos There are bathroom facilities and watersoft drinks available at the park MEET Take Highway from Houston about miles miles past Hempstead until you come to the flashing light at the intersection of Highway and FM Theres a sign that says Chappell Hill to the right Turn right on FM and go about mile to the center of town The nd street on the right is Poplar Take a right and go a block or two past the church and park on the side road connecting Poplar and Providence Happy Pedaling Amelia o

SHOCKING NEWS some shocking news about Enrons fundraising stars Would you believe this Dan Lyons Hes not too far from doubling what he raised last year and he has three weeks to go Ray Sylvester Jordan Hunter Another huge increase over last year I hope this is incentive for all of us to get cracking we have a larger goal this year but I know we can do it I know there are more good stories out there in the pledging jungle so shoot me a note and let me know how youre doing I want to tell you about a new friend of mine I met her just last weekend She has MS diagnosed in She walks very slowly with a cane and needed help negotiating her way across a thin throw rug on the floor When she found out about our bike ride she pledged to me and let me know how important this activity is to her Research is very important client services to MS patients are very important giving them hope is very important and thats what we do when were out there raising money for their future My new friend asked me to pass along to each and every one of you her very grateful appreciation for all you do If you have any fundraising questions or I can help you in any way please give me a call at

to assist you with any breakdowns

MS Media Dayare invited to attend Isuzu MS Bike Tour Media Day Monday March am pm Quebedeaux Park Adjacent to the Family Law Center Congress San Jacinto in downtown Houston We need your help in spreading the word abou the Isuzu MS Your story could go a long way in driving up attendance and generating pledges The MS Society is hosting the MS Media Day for journalists from Houston to Austin in order to encourage their coverage of this spectacular event The more people that know about the Bike Tour the more that participateand ultimately the more funds that are raised to unravel the mysteries of multiple sclerosis We would like you on hand to share your story about why you are riding the MS or past experiences on the Tour All we ask is that you stop by Quebedeaux Park Monday March and if possible wear your bike jersey It is a casual outdoor event and lunch will be provided We will also have training tips cycling pros and veteran advice available you cant lose It will be a fun time for all and a great way to gear up for this years event

GREETINGS FROM JOSEPH Cc with Joseph Kaye last evening He is now in a private room and is healing as fast as he can He is able to sit up by himself and can walk the hall with assistance His remarkable recovery is no doubt due to his equally remarkable attitude His left arm is in a cast and he is in a lot of pain from the fractures to his face and the back of his skull Its difficult for him to eat because of the discomfort remaining from the intubation which had kept him alive immediately following the accident In spite of all the above he looks toward his full recovery and wanted me to tell you that he knows he is alive because of your prayers He was proudly wearing an MS finish pin on his hospital gown which Pat Bertotti took to him and was thrilled with the finish cap from Team Enron When I asked what hed like to tell the team he asked me to send you his love and his appreciation for your prayers He also asked that you always remember how precious life is how precious our basic life functions are that we sometimes take for grantedHe shared with me that his Pedal Partner Tim Hart had come to visit him at the hospital to thank him for the effort he made to ride and raise money for MS Joseph knows that the pain and struggle he has now will be gone in time but that his Pedal Partner has year after year to deal with the circumstances of managing his life with MS Joseph purchased just before the tour a great pair of sunglasses with prescription lenses They were totaled in the crash and I thought it would be a good idea for the team to replace those glasses for him If youd like to donate to this please send your checks to me It wouldnt take much from each rider and what we have left we can donate to MS in Josephs honor since Im sure hell not be in any shape to collect his pledges before deadline and I know he is concerned about the pledges he had promised He is very devoted to this cause Make your checks payable to Enron Cycling Club and send to address below Please make sure if you are also sending a getwell card to Joseph to put your check in a separate envelope as I do not open the correspondence you send to him All riders donating to the glasses will have their names included on the presentation We have sent him a floral arrangmeent from the team for delivery today He enjoyed the mail you have sent and if you have any more cards and letters MIRACLE IN BELLVILLE Cc of you know one of our beloved team members had a serious accident during the MS on Saturday just before the Bellville lunch stop His name is Joseph Kaye and he is a twoyear veteran of Team Enron He was taken by helicopter to a trauma unit in the medical center where he remains in ICCU I want you to know that even though his prognosis was bleak at one time he has come out of his coma has demonstrated control of all his extremities and we are anticipating a full recovery He has several fractures of his skull which will heal and he has no spinal impairment This healing is a miracle unfolding I have just returned from a visit with Josephs family I told them you have been emailing and calling and they asked me to thank you for all the concern you have expressed and the prayers that have been sent his way The family asked that I receive any cards or letters you may wish to send and I will make sure they are delivered as appropriate Please send to Amelia Alder Enron Corp PO Box Suite AC Houston TX We have been unable to determine the cause of the accident and only know that it did not involve a collision with a motor vehicle or another bike And you might knowthose of you who share his passion of cyclingsome of the first thoughts he was able to communicate by writing with his good hand were Wheres my bike Please keep Joseph in your thoughts and prayers and I will keep you posted if there is any other news Best regards Amelia
